class.name: WebViewOverlay
class.brief_description: Control that displays web pages (HTML / CSS / JavaScript).
class.description:
WebViewOverlay control uses the following native backends: * macOS: WKWebView * Windows: Microsoft Edge WebView2 (WIP)
WebViewOverlay supports "res://" and "user://" custom schemes to access Godot virtual file system and "gdscript://" scheme for callbacks.
WebViewOverlay is rendered on top of the main window and have some restrictions: * Control should be used only in the main 2D viewport. * Control is always rendered on top of other controls / nodes. * Rotation or scale are ignored. * Shaders / materials, modulate and light mask are ignored.

method.name: can_go_back
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code], if it is possible to navigate backward.

method.name: can_go_forward
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code], if it is possible to navigate forward.

method.name: execute_java_script
method.description: Runs the given JavaScript code asynchronously, script return value is ignored.

method.name: get_snapshot
method.description:
Generates an image from the page's contents asynchronously. Snapshot can be taken from the hidden control as well. When the image is ready, [code]snapshot_ready[/code] signal is emitted.
Note: Snapshots do not include external media content (e.g. YouTube videos) and scrollbars.

method.name: is_loading
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if current page is loading.

method.name: is_secure_content
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if all resources on the current page are loaded through the encrypted connection.

method.name: load_string
method.description: Loads page from the [code]source[/code] string. [code]url[/code] is used to resolve relative URLs within the [code]source[/code] string.

members.member: If [code]true[/code], control background can be transparent.
The URL of the current page.
The zoom factor of the page.

signal.name: callback
signal.description: Emitted when request for the [code]gdscript://*[/code] URL is received.

signal.name: finish_navigation
signal.description: Emitted when page loading process is finished.

signal.name: snapshot_ready
signal.description: Emitted when page snapshot image is ready to use.

signal.name: start_navigation
signal.description: Emitted when page loading process is started.
